New Records: Chris Sale is tied for the league lead in wins (16), but stands alone atop both the ERA (2.38) and strikeout (213) categories.
Key Match Events: The Braves erased deficits in two of the final three innings and moved back into a tie with the Mets for the NL's final Wild Card spot.
Eli White's 11th inning experience began with a bunt single and ended with a celebratory dash to the plate.
Raisel Iglesias surrendered George Springer's two-out RBI single in the 11th inning, but the run was unearned.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Brian Snitker emphasized the importance of strong pitching performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brian Snitker said, 'That was probably my top two or three most draining games I've ever been a part of.'
Sean Murphy said, 'I got the hit at the end, but that's all about the pitching. They carried us through. I'm just glad we got that last one.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a thrilling 4-3, 11-inning win for the Braves.
The Braves' win was their second in a row, and they moved back into a tie with the Mets for the NL's final Wild Card spot.
